Title: Inter, Milan & Roma on High Alert After Manager Delivers Huge Update on Liverpool Misfit
Content: The Cult of Calcio Italian Football and Serie A News in English Liverpool manager Arne Slot has delivered a significant update on Federico Chiesa amid the Italian’s underwhelming start at Anfield. Speaking to the press in the build-up to Saturday’s Premier League clash against Fulham via Calciomercato, the Dutchman confirmed the former Juventus winger lacks regular first-team action. Chiesa left Turin to join Liverpool in a £10 million deal in the summer after being deemed surplus to requirements by new Juventus manager Thiago Motta. However, he has only collected 78 minutes on Merseyside this season across three cameo appearances. Low in the pecking order, Chiesa could soon request a transfer, with several Serie A clubs vying for his signature. In addition to long-term admirers Inter, Milan and Roma are keen on bringing the unsettled Reds star back to his homeland. “What he needs is to play, the problem is that if he hasn’t played for five or six months, sometimes it’s difficult for a coach to give him his first minutes because you don’t exactly know what to expect,” Slot said about Chiesa. “Yes, I see him on the training pitch, but ideally, it would be better to see him in a friendly during the week, or in an Under-21 match or something like that. But this is not our situation: we play so many matches. So maybe the game against Southampton could be a good moment for him to get some minutes on the field, and then we’ll know a bit better what we can expect from him. “If you only have training sessions, it’s not the same as game time. You need game time to reach certain levels of fitness. But if you are fighting for the championship and fighting in the Champions League, it’s not always easy to find these minutes unless sometimes we are ahead 4-0 or 5-0, but I think that has only happened once all season.“ Chiesa has lost his place on the national team. Leaving Liverpool could increase his chances of regaining Luciano Spalletti’s trust, so a January return to Italy could be a genuine possibility for the versatile forward. Title: Napoli Pull Plug on Long-Term Pursuit of Juventus Stalwart
Content: The Cult of Calcio Italian Football and Serie A News in English Serie A giants Napoli have reportedly pulled the plug on their pursuit of Juventus captain Danilo ahead of the January transfer window. According to Radio Kiss Kiss via TMW, Partenopei sporting director Giovanni Manna has switched his sights on Inter stalwart Stefan de Vrij. Danilo has recently emerged as a concrete transfer target for Napoli after losing his indispensable first-team status under Thiago Motta. However, long-term injuries to Gleison Bremer and Juan Cabal have thrown the Brazilian veteran a lifeline at the Allianz Stadium. Strapped for reliable options at the back, Motta has reinstated Danilo, whose deal at Juventus runs out at the end of the season. Napoli had hoped to capitalize on the 33-year-old’s contract wobble before deciding to focus on other targets. Juventus are having second thoughts about Danilo’s future at the club. After initially deciding against renewing his expiring contract, they are now open to offering him a short-term extension. Therefore, Napoli have identified De Vrij as a new top defensive target. The 32-year-old Dutchman has been outstanding since swapping Lazio for Giuseppe Meazza in 2018. However, he’ll be out of contract in the summer of 2025, with Inter seemingly reluctant to propose fresh terms. That could change if De Vrij continues to go from strength to strength. Indeed, the rumored Napoli target has excelled in Francesco Acerbi’s absence, delivering outstanding performances in numerous high-profile matches. Despite entering the autumn of his playing career, De Vrij is still one of the most dependable center-backs in Serie A. Your email address will not be published. Title: Fiorentina Starlet Edoardo Bove Discharged from Hospital
Content: The Cult of Calcio Italian Football and Serie A News in English Fiorentina midfielder Edoardo Bove has reportedly left the Careggi hospital in Florence two weeks after being admitted in critical condition. According to Sky Sport via Calciomercato, the Roma loanee left the hospital on Friday afternoon after recovering from cardiac arrest. Bove underwent surgery on December 10 for the implantation of the removable subcutaneous defibrillator. The subcutaneous defibrillator implanted is removable, and Bove will have the option to keep it or have it removed based on the results of future medical evaluations. The 22-year-old collapsed on the pitch in a Serie A meeting between Fiorentina and Inter on December 1. Heart-stopping moments at Stadio Artemio Franchi sent shockwaves through the football community in Italy and abroad. Quickly after being admitted to the hospital, the Fiorentina youngster spent a couple of days in the intensive care unit of Careggi before being transferred to the UTC. Thankfully, Bove has fully recovered and is ready to return to Viola Park to greet his teammates and manager, Raffaele Palladino. However, Bove’s career in Serie A is over. He will no longer be allowed to compete in professional sports in Italy, mirroring the case of Christian Eriksen, who had to leave Inter in 2021. The Fiorentina starlet must wait to receive comprehensive documentation from his tests, which will determine whether his myocarditis is genetic or inflammatory in origin, helping to assess the potential risks he might face moving forward. As for Fiorentina, they’ll likely dive back into the market this winter to strengthen Palladino’s midfield options amid La Viola’s incredible season in Serie A. Title: Juventus and Inter set to compete with Barcelona for Leverkusen’s Jonathan Tah
Content: Serie A outfits Juventus and Inter have to beat Barcelona to sign Bayer Leverkusen’s Jonathan Tah. According to a report by Daniele Longo, Juventus and Inter are eyeing a potential free transfer for Leverkusen’s Tah next summer. The German defender’s contract with Xabi Alonso’s side expires in June 2025 and any club interested in him can agree on a transfer without dealing with his current club. Juventus and Inter do not want to miss out on a strong and proven centre-back as they aim to send him proposals this winter but it appears that Barcelona have emerged as the frontrunners in the race to land Tah. The Blaugranas’ sporting director Deco has contacted the 28-year-old’s entourage but is yet to accept their conditions. As for the Italian sides, neither Juventus nor Inter can match the Tah’s demands but negotiations are set to take place even though Barcelona have the edge. Title: Bastoni Picks Between Scudetto and UCL, Talks Offers
Content: The Cult of Calcio Italian Football and Serie A News in English Inter mainstay Alessandro Bastoni discussed the current season and more topics in an interview with Libero (via Goal). “In terms of grade, I’d give an eight to the team and myself. We started slowly because of the short turnaround with the previous campaign. We got back on track. At the end of August, we would have signed to be in this situation in the Champions League and Serie A.” Bastoni addressed the loss to Bayer Leverkusen. “A defeat is never easy to stomach, but, analyzing everything, you just need to look at where Bayern Munich, Manchester City, and Real Madrid are to see that we’re doing well. If you are used to excellence, you have to maintain that standard. Clearly, we can’t win every game. It’s ludicrous to argue with the rotations. It wouldn’t be normal to always be 100 percent mentally. And the team suffers if you aren’t. Resting is essential.” Bastoni had the chance to leave in the past. “Some sides inquired about me, but I’ve always given my priority to Inter. There’s a life outside of football, and my family is great here. Plus, this club fights to win every competition. I’ve never given half a thought to leaving.” The center-back discussed Simone Inzaghi. “His virtue is that he makes everybody feel part of the group and fundamental to the cause. Instead, a defect was maybe that we had trouble understanding his football at first. That’s partly up to us since had Antonio Conte who was completely different.” Bastoni made his pick between winning another Scudetto or reaching the Champions League final again. “Surely the latter. We lacked some luck and self-awareness in Istanbul. We know that we’re at that level now.” Your email address will not be published. Required fields are marked * Comment * Name * Email * Website Δ

Title: Inter Touch Base with Future Star Free Agent in Germany
Content: The Cult of Calcio Italian Football and Serie A News in English Inter took advantage of the recent trip to Leverkusen to meet with the agent of Jonathan Tah. The defender is reportedly close to agreeing to a contract with Barcelona, but the race is still somewhat open. He denied having convened with Blaugrana director Deco after the reports. According to La Gazzetta dello Sport, the Nerazzurri have no doubts about his level and fit. His performance against them further proved it. On the other hand, they aren’t the only side chasing him, and his demands are significant. The summit between the Inter brass and the entourage of Tah was mostly preliminary. The parties set the stage for possible future discussions. The salary requested by the defender is too high for the Serie A side’s standards at this stage, but they haven’t completely shut the door for now. Oaktree plots to progressively do away with Bosman signings involving veterans with high wages. On the other hand, the German international isn’t too old, as he’s 28. The outcome of their chase depends on how much other teams will offer. In the meantime, the Scudetto holders are mulling whether to add to their backline in January already. Francesco Acerbi continues to struggle to stay healthy. He’s not expected to return versus Lazio either. Despite Udinese’s stance, Jaka Bijol would be their top target if they opted to make a move. He’ll be a great get for whoever signs him, but it’d be surprising if it were the Nerazzurri given the latest hints about their future strategy. Title: Subpar Offensive Production Starting to Hinder Inter
Content: The Cult of Calcio Italian Football and Serie A News in English Inter hit a low point offensively in the clash with Bayer Leverkusen, as they didn’t have any shot on target. It’s the first time it has happened in three years. The Nerazzurri were seemingly settling for a draw but gave up a late goal. Per La Gazzetta dello Sport, they had last failed to have an attempt on goal back in February of 2022 in a Champions League bout versus Liverpool. While their results have been sound, their frontline hasn’t been fearsome. Marcus Thuram has been their lone consistent scorer, while Lautaro Martinez has been up and down, and their deputies, including Mehdi Taremi, whom they landed after a lengthy chase, have brought very little to the table. While that’s not a surprise for Marko Arnautovic and Joaquin Correa, who have seen the pitch sparingly, Inter were expecting more from the Iranian marksman. He has started in every continental match but has found the target just once. He has yet to do it in Serie A. While Thuram has carried the burden, Martinez has hit the net six times and is way behind schedule relative to his standards. He has squandered major chances too. The issue is there but it’s a first-word one for now. They have still collectively bagged 34 goals in Serie A, which makes them the second-most prolific side league-wide, and their results haven’t suffered. El Toro isn’t new to multi-month slumps, and they’ll go on a run once he catches fire. It’ll be a problem for other sides since Thuram has gone up a level and his pace seems totally sustainable. Title: Ismajli Agent Talks Race Between Napoli and Juventus
Content: The Cult of Calcio Italian Football and Serie A News in English Ardian Ismajli has had a strong start to the season quarterbacking the Empoli defense and has drawn the interest of Napoli and Juventus. His agent and intermediary Serxhio Mezi revealed that he has been in touch with the Azzurri to set up the deal in an interview with Tribuna. “I’ve been talking with Napoli for a year. He could have joined them last January. We discussed about it with director Mauro Meluso and worked on such a transfer with Ciro Palermo. I don’t know if the deal will go through, but the two presidents are friendly, which could help in the negotiation.” Instead, Mezi instead dismissed the chatter about Inter and Juventus. “He’s been linked, but there’s nothing there. Thiago Motta didn’t want him when he was at Bologna. I doubt that the Bianconeri will chase him even if they are looking for a center-back.” Ismajli is in a particular situation because his contract lasts only until the end of the season. “Do you think a Serie A team would spend €2M, €3M, or €4M for a 29-year-old player they could sign on a free in June? Napoli are a different matter. He was offered to Roma and Daniele De Rossi too. Though, they discarded him because they didn’t think he was ready for that level.” It looks like the Partenopei have the inside track. Being a reliable deputy in a top team is arguably the right dimension for him. Perhaps a multi-player deal or a short-term renewal with a low release clause would facilitate a small investment in light of his contractual status. Your email address will not be published. Title: €50 million not enough to prize Gittens away from Dortmund, underlines Ricken
Content: Jamie Gittens has taken the next step in his development this season and has emerged as a regular starter for Borussia Dortmund under Nuri Sahin. The 20-year-old winger's performances are likely to have attracted interest from other clubs, but Borussia Dortmund are keen to keep hold of him. When asked what he would do if someone from another club called and offered €50 million for Gittens, Borussia Dortmund's managing director for sport, Lars Ricken, told Sport Bild: I wouldn't hang up immediately because that's not my character. But I would respectfully decline.” He wouldn't say what kind of fee would make Dortmund consider selling the young winger, but simply added: “We are in a challenging situation and we want to develop from a sporting point of view. Basically, we want to keep players of such high quality for longer. This also applies to Jamie, who has a long-term contract.” Gittens, who is contracted to Borussia Dortmund until 2028, has scored nine goals and provided four assists in 22 appearances this season.

Title: Dortmund show serious interest in Wanner, report claims
Content: Widely regarded as one of the brightest talents in German football, Paul Wanner has a number of admirers, with Borussia Dortmund said to be one of them. According to Sport Bild, the Black and Yellows are seriously pursuing the 18-year-old, who is currently on loan at Heidenheim from Bayern Munich. The report claims that Wanner's name is coming up more and more frequently in meetings held by the club's management. Wanner and his agent are aware of Dortmund's general interest, but no concrete negotiations have yet taken place. Ideally, Dortmund would like to sign Wanner permanently, but with Bayern currently unwilling to sell, they've discussed the possibility of taking the 18-year-old out on loan, believing he can make an immediate impact, even in the Champions League. Wanner himself would like to be a regular in a Champions League side next year. As he would likely get more playing time at Dortmund than at Bayern, that could argue for a move to Signal Iduna Park. Wanner has scored six goals and provided two assists in 21 appearances for Heidenheim this season.

Title: Match Ratings: Borussia Dortmund Bore Their Way to Draw With Hoffenheim
Content: Filed under: BVB weren’t just bad. They were boring. The worst kind of bad. Borussia Dortmund put in a poor performance against Hoffenheim on Sunday afternoon but it looked like they would come away with three points anyway, following a brilliant Gio Reyna goal scored at the beginning of the second half. Unfortunately, former BVB player Jacob Bruun Larsen found the Hoffenheim equalizer in the 91st minute, which was no less than they deserved. Hoffenheim were the better side in a drab game that was light in both quality and entertainment. They were well organized and had the best of the game’s few goalscoring opportunities. It wasn’t a dazzling Hoffenheim performance, but there were at least some positives for the away side. In contrast, Dortmund seemed utterly devoid of ideas or creativity and can consider themselves lucky to come away with anything from this game. BVB had shown some signs of progress under Nuri Şahin recently, but this was a return to the same issues Dortmund have struggled with this season. They struggled for anything resembling consistent offense, relying too heavily on a moment of magic from someone to give them the advantage. Once ahead, they never looked like holding onto their lead. A draw at home against Hoffenheim isn’t good enough, but the more significant issue was the performance. It was lifeless. He held his own against Hoffenheim, which is especially impressive given the assumption we wouldn’t see him on the pitch for a while. He was probably trying a little too hard to put the team on his back, but there wasn’t much being offered by anyone else. Sean: 6 At least he looked dangerous at times. Paul: 5 Sean: 5 Paul: 5 Sean: 5 I know Paul and I aren’t saying much in our comments, but it’s tough when virtually nothing happened in the game. Paul: 5 Sean: 5 Paul: 3 I wouldn’t usually rate a player who played less than ten minutes. Unfortunately for Lührs, his short debut was a nightmare after a glaring error that led to Hoffenheim’s goal. Sean: 3 Paul: 4 I suppose Dortmund weren’t abysmal. You could possibly give them credit for not giving up much on the defensive end. The trouble is, barely anything happened in the game, and what did happen favored Hoffenheim more than Dortmund. It could have been a lot worse, and if BVB were in otherwise good form, this sort of game wouldn’t be a big deal, but it’s a continuation of a season of this nonsense. Title: Borussia Dortmund eye Bayern Munich talent Paul Wanner
Content: With Borussia Dortmund preparing their transfer targets for 2025, the Westfalen outfit have identified Bayern Munich talent Paul Wanner for a potential transfer, according to BILD. The 18-year-old, currently on loan at Heidenheim, is valued at €15m by Transfermarkt, and is regarded as one of the brightest prospects in German football. Die Schwarzgelben have been scouting Wanner for years and were close to signing the German-Austrian in 2021 until Bayern Munich blocked a transfer at the eleventh hour. And now Wanner has come to the attention of Dortmund once again. Per BILD, the attacking-midfielder has been mentioned as BVB’s recruitment team plan their transfer targets ahead of the 2025/26 season. Both Lars Ricken and Sebastian Kehl believe that Wanner has what it takes to play at Champions League level already. Wanner’s Bayern Munich contract runs until 2027 and the Rekordmeister aren’t planning to sell their talent, but although Dortmund wish to sign the playmaker on a permanent basis, a loan deal has been discussed although club bosses are yet to make any concrete approach although Wanner knows of Borussia’s interest. But Dortmund will face competition to sign Wanner. Should Florian Wirtz leave Bayer Leverkusen or Xavi Simons departs RB Leipzig, then the Bundesliga duo, as well as Eintracht Frankfurt and Stuttgart, will target the German youth international. Title: New European Super League proposal launched after rebrand
Content: A new format of the European Super League has been launched following a rebrand from promoters, as reported by Kicker. Promoters A22 have contacted UEFA and FIFA to seek official recognition for its new competition. The new version is called the Unify League and would feature 64 clubs around Europe competing in three divisions. Unlike the European Super League, this version would include promotion and relegation rather than a set number of teams gaining qualification based on past success. It’s unclear how the project would finance itself and exactly who the donors behind the new format are. The exact details remain vague as many football fans around Europe start to wonder if people associated with their club are backing the proposal. A letter addressed to UEFA General Secretary reads: “This behaviour is incompatible with an organisation that must be open, transparent and free from conflicts of interest at all times.” The European Court of Justice (ECJ) ruled last December UEFA’s rules to block the Super League were contrary to EU law. UEFA has yet to comment on A22’s new proposal. GGFN | Jamie Allen @2023 - All Rights Reserved. Get Football Group

Title: Jamie Gittens is a Cheat Code
Content: Filed under: The young Englishman’s possession and dribbling metrics are utterly bonkers. Over the years, countless great young players have donned the beloved black and yellow of Borussia Dortmund. We fans have been treated to jaw-dropping football displays by world-class talents. You already know their names: Erling Haaland, Jadon Sancho, Jude Bellingham, Christian Pulisic, and Ousmane Dembélé, among others. In the last few years, Dortmund’s success at finding and rearing young talent has waned, but even amid a season that is lackluster by this club’s standards, there is currently one young player right now proving week in and week out that he’s worth tuning in to watch him play. Jamie Gittens might not have come to Dortmund with the same heavy accolades as Bellingham or Haaland, and his star may not have risen in such a meteoric fashion, but after several years of showing flashes of potential without putting it all together, his career in Dortmund is finally beginning to take off. First, let’s put in context just how good Jamie Gittens has been this season. He leads Dortmund in combined goals and assists this season, surpassing even Serhou Guirassy and Julian Brandt. He’s benefited from some exceptional finishing, but I would argue that aside from the actual finishing, he is driving play like no other BVB player. In fact, I think you can make the case that Gittens is currently one of, if not the most effective player in the entire Bundesliga with the ball at his feet. Gittens’ pace and dribbling skills have always been his bread and butter. I think few people realize because I didn’t fully comprehend it until I started writing this article, how bonkers pretty much all of his dribbling stats are. Just to get us started, here are the top 10 Bundesliga players in successful take-ons per 90: As you can see, not only is Gittens in a highly elite company, but he’s also the best in the whole league - and it isn’t even all that close. Musiala and Wirtz might be at each other’s throats for second place, but Gittens is leaving them in the dust, with almost one full take-on more per 90 than Musiala, the next highest. If you think that Gittens is just stat-padding by attempting a bonkers amount of take-ons and only leading this category by brute force, his success rate is actually a tick *higher* than Musiala and only a tick lower than Wirtz. So he beats defenders as successfully as these players, but his output is significantly higher. The ability to beat defenders 1-on-1 is vital in breaking down a low block and creating chances. Gittens also leads the Bundesliga in successful take-ons that result in shot attempts, indicating that his take-ons aren’t just going nowhere and are actually producing chances. To further illustrate this, here are the top 10 Bundesliga players in carries into the opponents’ penalty area per 90 minutes: What a shock: Gittens is number one. This one is at least close, with Omar Marmoush putting up a good fight, but it drops off quickly after that. Gittens is not just contributing in the attacking third. Borussia Dortmund have sometimes struggled to progress the ball through the opponents’ press, despite frequently maintaining the lion’s share of possession. Here are the top 10 Bundesliga players in overall progressive carries per 90 minutes. Take a guess who’s number one: In a season in which it can be hard to find bright spots for Borussia Dortmund, Jamie Gittens has been a breath of fresh air and a constant source of excitement. His game is still not fully rounded. He still has the occasional turnover. His expected goal and expected assists per 90 minutes combined are “only” 0.36, which is not bad, but not great. Then again, almost nobody on BVB is doing well by that metric. At the end of the day, Gittens has managed to put up some utterly bonkers numbers while surrounded by a team that has stumbled from week to week in the first half of the season. At times, it has seemed that Gittens has had to take the entire team and put it on his shoulders. His amazing goal against Bayern Munich is proof of this: As poor Konrad Laimer found out, Gittens is one talented kid. If Nuri Sahin can find a way to consistently utilize him successfully, then defenders across Europe will tremble as he gallops down their throats. Gambling Problem? Title: Sahin's Dortmund job doesn't appear to be in danger - for now
Content: Pressure is mounting on Borussia Dortmund coach Nuri Sahin after a 1-1 draw with Hoffenheim extended his side's winless run to four games and dropped them to eighth in the Bundesliga table. However, according to local publication Ruhr Nachrichten, Sahin isn't in any danger of losing his job for the time being, as those in charge still believe he can steady the ship. Sahin's relationship with sporting director Sebastian Kehl and managing director for sport Lars Ricken is said to be intact, but he needs to deliver results to keep his job. Dortmund's minimum target for the season is Champions League qualification, but they currently sit eighth in the table, five points behind fourth-placed RB Leipzig. Sahin took over as Borussia Dortmund coach last summer, replacing Edin Terzic.

Title: Match Observations: Dortmund Concede Stoppage Time Equalizer to TSG Hoffenheim
Content: Filed under: Jacob Bruun-Larsen scored a stoppage time at the Westfalenstadion today. Unfortunately, you’re reading this it’s the year 2024, not 2019, so that is a bad thing. At least JBL didn’t celebrate his goal, a fitting ending, because there was almost nothing at all to celebrate for either team in Dortmund today. If you were following BVB injury news, or read my match preview, you would have thought that the problem in this game was going to be a ramshackle back-line full of spare parts held together with duct tape. In reality, the back line wasn’t that bad! Nico Schlotterbeck, who wasn’t supposed to return until 2025, turned out to not miss a single minute after his injury against Barcelona. Emre Can played next to him, and Bensebaini and Couto played at full-back. That’s a decent back line, at least on paper. Instead, if there was one absence that was notably felt, it was Julian Brandt. Between Jamie Gittens, Maximilian Beier, and then Karim Adeyemi, Dortmund dominated the wide areas, but consistently struggled to penetrate centrally, once again relying on 1-on-1s from their wide players. Serhou Guirassy received such scant service, and had so many responsibilities dropping deep, that he only managed 31 touches and only 2 in the box in the full 90 minutes. As a whole, BVB mustered one measly shot attempt in the first half, although Hoffenheim did almost concede an own goal, and Serhou Guirassy had a penalty taken away by VAR because he decided to try to win one by diving. Even Dortmund’s goal came somewhat out of nowhere. It wasn’t a total fluke, but it did result from a fortuitous bounce. Gittens looped in a mostly speculative cross that Hoffenheim’s Stanley N’Soki headed right into Gio Reyna, who lashed the ball into the net. It was a great moment for Gio Reyna, but unfortunately BVB couldn’t make it stick. For all of BVB’s offensive struggles, for most of the match Hoffenheim were only slighter better, and sometimes even worse. According to Understat, Hoffenheim did not register a single shot attempt after the 61st minute until their stoppage time equalizer. Unfortunately, Jamie Gittens or Karim Adeyemi couldn’t manufacture a second goal all on their own today, so Hoffenheim stayed in reach, giving them the chance to ultimately equalize. It was an ugly game, so you know they would tie it up with an ugly goal. Valentin Gendry launched a long throw into the box, which Felix Nmecha and Bensebaini failed to clear. The ball looped to the back post, and Dortmund legend Jacob Bruun-Larsen out-muscled another more recent BVB youth product, Yannik Lührs, to the ball. At least he didn’t celebrate! Title: Bruun Larsen on subdued goal celebration: "BVB means a lot to me and my family."
Content: Hoffenheim attacker Jacob Bruun Larsen wasn't in much of celebratory mood even after his dramatic late equalizer helped his team nick a draw off Dortmund last night. The 26-year-old - not exactly a stranger to adversity at this stage of his professional career - kept it subdued after notching the 1-1 at 90+1. The former Danish international joined the BVB youth ranks in 2015 and remained with the Westphalian club for five years. “Everyone who knows me knows what this club means to me and my family,” Bruun Larsen noted in the mixed zone last night, ”BVB supported me during a difficult time when I was younger. Dortmund believed in me and signed me to a professional contract when I was injured. [Former] sporting director Michael Zorc even visited me in the hospital. Bruun Larsen didn't react much when teammates Alexander Prass and Stanley approached him to deliver congratulations. In this particular case, Bruun Larsen's emotional reaction was to show as little emotion as possible. The TSG winger went into still further depth when explaining this in his post-match comments. “We did deserve a point,” said Bruun Larsen, but scoring for the first time as an opponent in this stadium is something I'll never forget.”

Title: Sahin after Reyna's first goal in 19 months: "Gio can become important for us."
Content: After featuring in the Borussia Dortmund starting XI in the Champions' League midweek, the American footballing prospect once referred to as the American Dream received another start in Sunday's league fixture against TSG 1899 Hoffenheim. Matters certainly went well for the 22-year-old. Reyna scored his first goal in BVB colors since match-day 32 of the 2022/23 campaign. Thanks to plenty of promising work at a young age, Reyna still has 95 German top flight appearances to his credit. The son of former USMNT captain Claudio Reyna and six-times-capped USWNT professional Danielle Egan has scored a total of 18 goals for Dortmund in 105 appearances across all competitions. His tally last night agains highlighted his natural talent. A sublime chest down and fearless finish from about 15 meters out might serve as a profound statement that the former American Dream (recently referred to as U.S. Soccer's lost boy in a New York Times article) is ready to return to the Bundesliga stage. Multiple injuries, a failed loan stint at Nottingham Forest, and verified rumors that his German club wish to offload him could quickly be forgotten if Reyna begins to produce again. Gio can become important for us if he remains fit, BVB trainer Nuri Sahin remarked at his post-match presser last night, [Despite more injuries], he's managed to keep at it, train well and present himself positively. I'm glad he scored today. [The recent loan to the EPL] helped him see the importance of getting playing time here at Dortmund.

Title: Schlotterbeck admits playing against Hoffenheim was an "extreme risk"
Content: Nico Schlotterbeck was stretchered off during Borussia Dortmund's 3-2 defeat to Barcelona on Wednesday, and it was later revealed that he had suffered a ligament injury. It was therefore a huge surprise to see him in the starting line-up for Borussia Dortmund's 1-1 draw with Hoffenheim in the Bundesliga on Sunday. It was an extreme risk, Schlotterbeck admitted in a post-match interview. The physios didn't necessarily give me the green light, but they said there was a possibility I could play, the centre-back added. He ended up playing 90 minutes in what he described as an unbelievably bad game from Dortmund. “That wasn't good enough. We are Borussia Dortmund, and if we can stay up there in the table by beating Hoffenheim at home, then we have to win, he fumed.

Title: Dortmund loanee expresses dissatisfaction with playing time at Wolfsburg
Content: Bild is speculating that Borussia Dortmund midfielder Salih Özcan's loan spell at Wolfsburg could be cut short. In an interview with the German tabloid, the 26-year-old makes it clear that he'd like to play more. Of course you're unhappy when you don't play, especially when I know I have the qualities to help the team, Özcan told Bild. “When you don't play, it always makes you think. That's not the case at the moment. I don't want to look into the future right now.” The fact that Özcan struggles to understand why he doesn't play more doesn't make things any easier. I don't really know myself. I can't explain it to myself. I give it my all in training, the coach knows what qualities I have. At the end of the day, the coach decides, I just have to keep going and stay positive. Then I think I'll get my chance, he said. Özcan has played 361 minutes in 11 appearances for Wolfsburg since joining from Borussia Dortmund last summer.

Title: Bundesliga Matchday 14 recap: Bayern loses, the race for Europe becomes closer, and reason for Bochum optimism.
Content: Matchday 14 in the Bundesliga gave us a lot of talking points and further tightened the table when it comes to the title and the race for Europe. With just five points separating 4th and 10th, there is plenty to talk about after the fallout of matchday 14 in the Bundesliga. Bayern Munich suffered their first Bundesliga defeat of the season as a Jae-Sung Lee brace secured all three points for Mainz 05. Bayern started the brighter of the two with Micheal Olise having two decent chances in the opening 10 mins, his first effort inside five minutes rattling the post. Mainz got their noses in front as Bayern failed to clear their lines and a wicked deflection fell kindly for Lee who simply couldn’t miss. Mainz’s second, however, was anything but lucky as a beautifully crafted move on the right-hand-side found Lee in the box who cleverly turned his man and smashed the ball home. The move queued wild celebrations from the Mainz faithful including head coach Bo Henriksen who must have thought Christmas had come early. Bayern did pull one back a few minutes from time when the ball fell kindly for Leroy Sané who couldn’t miss but Mainz held on for an impressive victory. Mainz get back to winning ways following defeat to Wolfsburg and are right in the mix for European contention on 22 points in 7th. Bayern will look to bounce back in a huge game against RB Leipzig on matchday 15. Marco Rose had been under a lot of pressure at RB Leipzig in recent weeks but it appears his side have finally turned the corner and are back on track (domestically anyway). Following a winless November, the Saxons have reached the last eight of the DFB Pokal and secured back-to-back Bundesliga wins with their latest victory against Eintracht Frankfurt as Rose’s side ran out 2-1 winners. Leipzig took the lead through Benjamin Šeško who was quickest to react following a smart save from Kevin Trapp – Šeško only had eyes for the lopping ball with the Frankfurt defence perhaps a little disorientated as to where the ball had actually gone – Šeško was left to cushion the ball into the net. What followed was a flurry of chances from both sides including Frankfurt’s Omar Marmoush whose freekick rattled the crossbar and was just inches away from going in. Should that set piece have found the net, it would have been Marmoush’s third consecutive goal from a free kick. Frankfurt did get themselves level through Nathaniel Brown who is having a breakout season to remember. This was just his 7th Bundesliga game and that was his third goal having already assisted twice this campaign. He was teed up beautifully on the left as his shot cannoned against the far post and in. Leipzig got the winner five minutes into the second half when a corner was flicked onto the back post where Loïs Openda was left free to volley the ball into the net. It’s another impressive display from Marco Rose’s men who must love to welcome Frankfurt to the Red Bull Arena. The win puts Leipzig level on points with Frankfurt as they move up into 4th, breathing down the necks of Frankfurt in 3rd. Bayer Leverkusen are back up into second and four points off top spot following a 0-2 victory away at FC Augsburg. That’s now seven consecutive wins in all competitions for Xabi Alonso’s side who appear to have found their form again following a rocky opening to the season. Up next is 5th place SC Freiburg. TSG Hoffenheim scored an injury time equaliser to rescue a point away at Borussia Dortmund. The away side were more deserving of their point as they had the better opportunities and shots at goal. The draw leaves BVB in 8th on 22 points while Hoffenheim are in 14th on 14 points. VfL Bochum played the majority of their match away at Union Berlin with ten men. Despite this, they held on for a point and even took the lead in the 23rd minute. It was completely one-way traffic with constant pressure from Union but Bochum held on for what may not seem like an important point considering they haven’t a game yet but it’s a sign they haven’t given up. After this, you feel their first win is only a matter of time. GGFN | Jamie Allen @2023 - All Rights Reserved. Get Football Group

Title: Sahin "angry and disappointed" after "very weak" Dortmund performance
Content: Borussia Dortmund let two points slip through their fingers as they drew 1-1 with Hoffenheim after conceding a late goal. Speaking after the game, Dortmund coach Nuri Sahin expressed his frustration with both the performance and the result. It was a very, very poor performance, maybe one of the poorest of the season. No energy on the pitch, no good positioning, a lot of patchwork . The early goal after half-time actually did us good. But it was only good for a few minutes. And then it was just like the first half. Still, you have to concede in the 90th minute if you want to achieve the goal we have. I'm angry and disappointed that we let two valuable points slip through our fingers. The draw leaves Dortmund eighth in the Bundesliga.

Title: MOTM Poll: A Disappointing Draw in Dortmund
Content: Filed under: A late equalizer earns Hoffenheim a deserved draw. The expected goal difference between Dortmund (0.58) against Hoffenheim (1.18) says it all. Dortmund simply weren’t good enough today, even with the energy of the yellow wall behind them. Christian Ilzer’s side came to play tonight, and the new Hoffenheim coach showed exactly why Hoffenheim chose him to take over after the dismissal of Pellegrino Matarazzo. The first 45 minutes were very scrappy, with both teams struggling to create chances. Hoffenheim efficiently played out of BVB’s press, and they managed to shut down Felix Nmecha in the midfield, hindering him in progressing the ball as we’ve seen a lot lately. When Gio Reyna fired Dortmund to 1-0 within the first minute of the second half, my spirits were high. Sadly, Gio Reyna’s goal seemed to be just one brilliant moment within 90 minutes of very mediocre football from BVB. Despite Sahin’s team having shown decent performances lately, they never really came out of first gear, and they were finally punished in stoppage time, when former BVB player, Jacob Bruun Larsen, wrestled the young Yannik Lührs off the ball inside the box and slotted the ball past Gregor Kobel. As this draw wasn’t frustrating enough in itself, Yan Couto also had to be subbed off due to injury, which means that there are now barely three first team players at Sahin’s disposal in defense. The winter break can’t really come quick enough at this point. So. Which players were less bad than the others tonight? Below you’ll find my nominees for MOTM. Can’t really get around it. If Gio hadn’t rocketed the ball into the net a handful of seconds into the second half, Dortmund would have dropped all three points at home tonight. Although Gio scored, he also had some very frustrating moments—most notably a sequence when he was played in behind and managed to trip over the ball, resulting in a wasted opportunity. Let’s at least hope that Gio can play himself into some kind of good form, because BVB simply need bodies at the moment. I think Nico Schlotterbeck was once again solid tonight. Strong in clearances and not at fault for the goal scored. He’ll also get a bonus point for not letting Gittens get himself sent off when the young Englishman was severely provoked by Arther Chaves. I don’t know if Schlotterbeck played through some pain tonight, but if he did, it was hard to see. I don’t really think it was that much Nmecha’s fault that he wasn’t able to impose himself on the game as much as one could’ve hoped. Hoffenheim simply knew his importance to this team, and they expertly blocked Dortmund’s passing lanes to the German international. Despite less involvement, I think Nmecha did well when he actually had the ball at his feet. He seemed very tired at the end, but that’s fully understandable given how much he has played lately. Bensebaini honestly did almost everything you could ask of him. The team as a whole just didn’t manage to get up the pitch today, which meant that the Algerian international had to do quite a lot of defending. He won the majority of his duels, and he had some decent crosses from set pieces. Gambling Problem? Call 1-800-GAMBLER (1-800-426-2537). Hope is here. Title: PLAYER RATINGS | Borussia Dortmund 1-1 Hoffenheim
Content: Borussia Dortmund were unable to hold on to their lead as a late Hoffenheim equalise meant Dortmund drew their third Bundesliga game in a row 1-1. From a Dortmund perspective, the first half was very underwhelming. They struggled to create any meaningful chance to trouble Oliver Baumann in the Hoffenheim net, in fact, they had just one shot in the entire first half. Dortmund were awarded a penalty after what was originally deemed a foul on Serhou Guirassy from Arthur Chaves, but VAR, rightly, overturned the decision. For Hoffenheim, they also failed to have a shot on target but looked a lot more dangerous than Dortmund especially when they were going forward. However, in the second half, Dortmund started very quickly when Giovanni Reyna scored his first Bundesliga goal in 582 days as he latched onto a poor clear from Hoffenheim. This trend did not last long as Hoffenheim continued to be the better side and Dortmund were unable to create any meaningful chances, shown by the fact they created no big chances in the whole game. Hoffenheim on the other hand continued to push for equalisers and they were rewarded late on when ex-Dortmund Jacob Bruun Larsen prodded home. For Hoffenheim, the result was probably unjust as they would feel like they could have come away with the three points, which goes to show the positive work that Christian Ilzer has done since arriving from Sturm Graz. While Dortmund were not good and lacked any creative spark and were lucky to draw this game. The positive for Dortmund is that on his return from injury, Karim Adeyemi looked lively but he was still unable to make up for the lack of creative spark. Apart from that it is clear that Dortmund need more options in the creativity department as without Julian Brandt and Jamie Gittens not at his best today, Dortmund had nothing. Title: Daily Schmankerl: Liverpool making run at Bayern Munich’s Alphonso Davies; Manchester City prepping last ditch effort for Florian Wirtz?; Dušan Vlahović to Manchester United?; Does Real Madrid know price on Theo Hernandez?; + MORE!
Content: Filed under: Is Liverpool trying to sneak up on Bayern Munich? Liverpool FC could be positioning itself in the mix to land Bayern Munich left-back Alphonso Davies: Liverpool have got what they need in order to accelerate a move for Alphonso Davies. The Canadian is reportedly on the shortlist. The Athletic claims Liverpool are in fact in the mix for Alphonso Davies. The left-back is out of contract in the summer and his destination isn’t as clear as it once was. Everyone assumed that Real Madrid would sign Davies. It appears that’s nowhere near a certainty, however, and Madrid don’t hold the power over the transfer that they once did. And so Liverpool are there, seeing what can happen. The Athletic’s report makes it clear that if Davies were to move to England, Anfield would be the ‘most plausible’ destination. It feels unlikely that Liverpool would be the club that reels in Davies, but weirder things have happened. Anyway, after months of Real Madrid looking like the frontrunner to land Davies, a contract extension with Bayern Munich now looks like the most likely option. Will the Bavarians get a deal done? Related Florian Wirtz appears to be on the cusp of signing a contract extension with Bayer Leverkusen, but if there is one club who might be able to blow away Die Werkself with a massive offer, it could be Manchester City. City is absolutely reeling at the moment under Pep Guardiola and could use a jolt of energy in the summer of 2025. Could Guardiola sway Wirtz to make the jump to England? Let’s see: Christian Falk has reported via his exclusive Daily Briefing column that he believes that Manchester City have every chance of signing Wirtz next summer. Falk believes that Pep Guardiola’s contract extension means that City have a big chance of landing their dream signing. Furthermore, Falk adds that Real Madrid and Bayern Munich are also keen to sign the German international. Lastly, Falk’s report gives the impression that it’s now a battle between three clubs to sign the Bayer Leverkusen star. To win a perceived transfer battle for Florian Wirtz. Manchester City would have to offer something that Bayern Munich or Real Madrid couldn’t. As per Falk’s report, it appears that those are City’s main rivals in the race for the German superstar. Bayern can offer Wirtz the opportunity to play at Germany’s biggest club. There is always an allure to that proposition for Germany’s finest talent. Real Madrid are Real Madrid. Generally, when they target one of the biggest talents, they usually get their man. But not always. Manchester City have one player who spurned Madrid’s advances to play at the Etihad. That is Erling Haaland. The hope is they can convince Wirtz to do the same. But how could they do it? As per Falk’s report playing under Pep Guardiola is an attractive proposition for any player. That is a well-established fact. There is an aura attached to playing under Guardiola. The hope is City can leverage that in any potential negotiations with Wirtz. There is also the offer of the German international leading a new era of dominance at Manchester City. Kevin De Bruyne, Ilkay Gundogan, Bernardo Silva and others are coming towards the end of their storied careers at Manchester City. So there is an opening there for a player like Wirtz to take over. He could possibly be the face of City’s new era alongside Erling Haaland, Phil Foden, Josko Gvardiol and others if he did choose to move to the Etihad next summer. Manchester City do hold their own trump cards in the perceived race for a player who would be their dream signing. If they are faced with a battle against Bayern Munich and Real Madrid for Florian Wirtz they must pull out all of the stops to secure his signature. He is that good and signing him could set up Manchester City’s next era of dominance in England and across Europe. Related This episode of the Bundesliga Rundown will be a special one! Title: Vincent Kompany gives update on Manuel Neuer’s contract situation, says Bayern Munich is trying to approach it “like a family”
Content: Filed under: As per usual, Bayern treats their legendary players with a lot of empathy and respect... Should Manuel Neuer get a new contract that ties him to Bayern Munich past 2025? There have been calls for Bayern to let the legendary goalkeeper go due to his declining shot stopping, but the noise from the media indicates that a renewal is on its way. When it comes to handling the departure of a legend such as Manuel Neuer, who is currently in his 13th season at the club since arriving from Schalke 04, a cold and casual release was never going to happen. Instead, head coach Vincent Kompany reveals a different approach to negotiations: “We’re trying to be a little bit like a family,” Kompany says, via @iMiaSanMia. “We always discuss it with the player first. Especially when he’s such a legend who has achieved so much.” One has to wonder how big Kompany’s role in the matter is, considering Christoph Freund and Max Eberl are those in charge of contracts at the club. But he reveals the truth we all should have known: Appreciation for Neuer’s past achievements were always going to come into play. Now the ones in charge need to find the perfect balance between such appreciation and the desire to move forward. Looking to catch up on all of the Bundesliga action from the weekend? Title: Lothar Matthäus anticipating winger moves for Bayern Munich in 2025
Content: Filed under: It’s time for fresh faces in here... One of Bayern Munich’s primary tasks is to offload high earners, and three of the wingers—Serge Gnabry, Kingsley Coman, and Leroy Sané—fall under this category. Selling even one of those players is easier said than done, but former Bayern player Lothar Matthäus wants to see transfer activity from his old club, especially in that department of the team. He even went as far as declaring that said three players won’t be at the club next year. “There will definitely be some changes in the wing positions,” Matthäus said (Sky90 via Goal). “There are three shaky candidates: Coman, Gnabry and Sané. They will not all three be staying at Bayern next year, even if I’m certainly not going to mention any names now. All three will definitely not stay. At least one will leave, and possibly even two, as new names are also being discussed for these positions in Munich.” Florian Wirtz appears to be out of reach regardless of whether or not he extended his contract with Bayer Leverkusen, which leaves Bayern with few viable options. Title: The rise of Bayern Munich star Jamal Musiala—Part 10: All caught up
Content: Filed under: Musiala has a long future ahead Bayern Munich’s Jamal Musiala is known for his silky dribbling and passing abilities, traits he would share with, as the segue in the last part of the series suggests, Thiago. “When we got on the pitch, I remember seeing Thiago playing two-touch with somebody across the entire pitch”, Musiala recounted (via Player’s Tribune). “Half to half. No mistakes. Perfect touch. I had never seen anything like it. I was just thinking: Oh my God. If I saw it right now, today, I would still be thinking: Oh my God. It didn’t even make sense. It was a glitch. Thiago is a glitch.” During one of the training sessions, he made it his goal to not show that he was 17, that he was able to keep up with the pros. Fast-forward to end of training, everyone was walking back to their club-sponsored Audis, but Musiala couldn’t drive home: no license or car. What now? “OK, we’re done. Can you come pick me up?” Mrs. Musiala rolls up to pick up her son like it’s his first day of school. The whole ride home he was just smiling like his mum. A lot of things went by in a blur since then: listening to Thomas Müller bark orders in an empty stadium, scoring his first goal (against Schalke in an 8-0 win), playing in a sold-out stadium for the first time, his first ever World Cup, winning Bayern the Bundesliga on the last day of the 2022/23 season, playing in the home Euros wearing the number 10 and Epic German Sax Guy. He’s seen it all, and he’s only 21. Basically, a single camera roll will have all the memories come flooding back. Funny enough, you could say that Musiala’s only getting started, and you’d be right. In 20 years, he’ll look back on a glittering career filled with trophies. Just you watch. Related Check your inbox for a welcome email. Oops. Something went wrong. Title: Transfer shocker? Borussia Dortmund reportedly keen on signing Bayern Munich talent Paul Wanner
Content: Filed under: The Bayern Munich wonderkid is gaining serious interest from top clubs. Paul Wanner has been a revelation this season. On loan for Bayern Munich at Heidenehim, the 18-year-old burst onto the scene with an incredible start to the 2024/25 season scoring goals and providing assists in all competitions. Top clubs have started to gain interest in the young player such as Borussia Dortmund. Among Dortmund, Bayer Leverkusen, Eintracht Frankfurt, VfB Stuttgart, and and RB Leipzig are also interested. In other words, every top German club is looking to sign Wanner. Dortmund is looking to sign Wanner on a permanent transfer to load up on further young talent. Dortmund is considering a loan as an alternative but it is not their priority. No concrete talks have taken place but Wanner is aware of Dortmund’s interest and the prospect of regular match time could prove intriguing for Wanner. Borussia Dortmund are interested in Paul Wanner. BVB scouts have been closely monitoring the youngster for years, following every little step of his development. Recently, Wanner's name has been mentioned more and more frequently in the important meetings of the Dortmund… pic.twitter.com/UmWt0zmEIT Certainly, Bayern have a plan for Wanner in future years but it is not certain that he would start for the club next season. It could benefit Bayern to loan out Wanner another year, but perhaps he is ready and wants to play for Bayern next season. Squad planning is certainly on all clubs’ radars at the moment but bigger pieces such as Jamal Musiala and Florian Wirtz need to be addressed at Bayern before these decisions can be made. Title: Dortmund show serious interest in Wanner, report claims
Content: Widely regarded as one of the brightest talents in German football, Paul Wanner has a number of admirers, with Borussia Dortmund said to be one of them. According to Sport Bild, the Black and Yellows are seriously pursuing the 18-year-old, who is currently on loan at Heidenheim from Bayern Munich. The report claims that Wanner's name is coming up more and more frequently in meetings held by the club's management. Wanner and his agent are aware of Dortmund's general interest, but no concrete negotiations have yet taken place. Ideally, Dortmund would like to sign Wanner permanently, but with Bayern currently unwilling to sell, they've discussed the possibility of taking the 18-year-old out on loan, believing he can make an immediate impact, even in the Champions League. Wanner himself would like to be a regular in a Champions League side next year. As he would likely get more playing time at Dortmund than at Bayern, that could argue for a move to Signal Iduna Park. Wanner has scored six goals and provided two assists in 21 appearances for Heidenheim this season.

Title: Jamal Musiala provides update on contract negotiations with Bayern Munich
Content: Speaking exclusively to Sport Bild, Jamal Musiala has provided an update on his contract situation at Bayern Munich. The 21-year-old’s current deal expires in 2026 and a new deal would see him become the Rekordmeister’s highest-paid player in club history, surpassing Harry Kane and Robert Lewandowski, but fans will have to wait a little longer for a positive update. “There is unfortunately no Christmas present that I can give fans yet,” Musiala told Sport Bild. “There will be no news anytime soon. We have had a lot of games recently, a lot of trips. My focus is on the games. I want to be free on the pitch. Even if you put a lot of pressure on me from the outside, I am relaxed.” When asked what the crucial factors are in a new contract, Musiala added: “There are many things that I pay attention to. For me it is important that I feel comfortable and can have fun on the pitch, that we are competitive and can compete for the title in the Champions League. “In summary, all the factors that contribute to this big decision for me simply have to feel good and right.” Musiala was named Player of the Year for the German men’s national team last week with 56 percent of the vote, ahead of Bayer Leverkusen’s Florian Wirtz who finished second with 38 percent, and Arsenal’s Kai Havertz with just six percent. A total of 145,000 votes were counted. GGFN | Daniel Pinder @2023 - All Rights Reserved. Get Football Group

Title: Musiala opens up about contract talks: "I can't give the fans a Christmas present"
Content: Bayern Munich have been working for months to extend Jamal Musiala's contract beyond 2026. However, a deal isn't imminent at the moment, as the 21-year-old reveals in an extensive interview with Sport Bild. Musiala said in November that he didn't expect a decision on his future to be made this year, and that hasn't changed. Unfortunately I can't give the fans a Christmas present. There won't be any news in the near future, Musiala told the German publication. He doesn't want to be rushed into a decision and wants to take his time. We've had a lot of games recently, a lot of travelling. My focus is to concentrate on the games. I want to be free on the pitch, even if there's a lot of pressure from outside, said Musiala. “All in all, all the parameters that contribute to this big decision have to feel good and right for me.” Although he hasn't yet signed a new contract yet, Musiala can see himself staying at Bayern for the long term. I would like to leave my mark on an era at FC Bayern. If I extend my contract with FC Bayern, that's my ambition and my goal, said Musiala. “But I also know that you have to work for it, with victories, titles and major trophies. Then you get that kind of prestige: I want to earn that at FC Bayern.”

Title: Thomas Müller talks relationship with Bayern Munich teammates and his influence on them
Content: Filed under: Role model for the next generation Although he is no longer a starting player for Bayern Munich, Thomas Müller has always put the club first, which is why he has no problem taking a backseat role to the current starting XI players. “At the moment I have the role of a back-up for one of the central players (Musiala & Kane). We can say thank God that the guys are always fit. I currently see myself in this role as far as my position is concerned”, (BR24 as captured by Twitter account @iMiaSanMia): “Every player also has a role in the dressing room, in the entourage of the team. During my entire career, I’ve always tried to do my best to make the team function as best as possible. It’s no different right now.” Vincent Kompany recently said that Jamal Musiala must look at everything that Müller does in training; the 21-year-old is after all considered the heir to Thomas’ throne. “Not in all situations,” Müller quipped. “I can also look up to him in a few things, even though implementing them would be tough. He has dribbling that’s rarely seen in football. But of course, it’s about the ‘easy’ goals, which are crucial in football. We can see that Jamal improved in that area. It’s nice for all of us.” Related Check your inbox for a welcome email. Oops. Something went wrong. Please enter a valid email and try again. Gambling Problem? Call 1-800-GAMBLER (1-800-426-2537). Title: Paul Wanner talks footballing influences, from his father to Lionel Messi
Content: Filed under: Messi is a pretty good player to model oneself after, to be fair... Paul Wanner’s playstyle is a distinctive, quick, intelligent and nimble one, always thinking 5 steps ahead of the opponent and looking for the most dangerous pass through the opposition defense. Though it is distinctive, however, in the long history of football, it is not quite unique. In fact, there are two players who the Bayern Munich loanee admits particularly influence this style of play: “(Lionel) Messi. He was and is simply the best player. But I would also say Neymar,” Wanner mused, via Sky Sports. “What he did with the ball, his dribbling - that was really great. Especially his time at Barca. I followed him and Messi a lot back then.” The (now former) FC Barcelona duo are not the only influences on his life as a footballer, however. In fact, the former FV Ravensburg youth player comes from a family of footballers: “Well, my father used to play in the second Austrian league. According to what he said, he was pretty good (laughs). I don’t know if that’s true. My grandfather played too, but not as high. But from what I’ve heard, he didn’t do too badly either. Maybe I even learned something from them (laughs).” Though it is up in the air how much the FC Heidenheim player learned from them both, it is clear that his focus on football had to come from somewhere. Did that focus leave any space for a Plan B, if a career in football did not pan out? “No, it was always just about football. I started with football very early. To be honest, I didn’t think about my Plan B. It was just football.” Related Check your inbox for a welcome email. Oops. Something went wrong. Please enter a valid email and try again. Title: Bayern Munich star Thomas Müller not thinking about his post-playing career just yet
Content: Filed under: We’ll cross that bridge when we get there... Thomas Müller’s role at Bayern Munich has been drastically reduced, casting uncertainty over his future beyond his current contract. Like all players bound to their current contract, he’s focused on finishing the season first. “At the moment, my full focus is on being a player – that’s exhausting enough,” Müller said (BR24 as captured by Twitter account @iMiaSanMia). There are many options, be it in the coaching field, as a TV pundit or even outside of football - maybe even something with my stud farm. But I’ve always felt comfortable doing one thing at a time. My full focus now is on being a player. Let’s wait and see.” A club management role is also a suitable job for the Munich legend, but again won’t commit to anything. “There are a few roles in the world of football that suit me well, but one thing at a time. I can’t do all of them at the same time,” he quipped. “But at some point I will have to make a decision - but it’s not time for that yet.” Related Check your inbox for a welcome email. Oops. Title: Is the DFB a toxic middle manager? Bayern Munich fined for being two minutes late for Bochum kickoff
Content: Filed under: Apparently, Bayern has received a considerable fine for being just two minutes late for their Bundesliga week 8 match against VfL Bochum. Everyone in their lifetime has had one of those toxic bosses and our middle managers that harps on every little detail in the office. Being one minute late for work, not being back from your lunch break at exactly the designated time, or straying from an already unrealistic project timeline. Most of corporate America has had to put up with that dynamic more time than they would want to admit, but this is apparently something that has affected Bayern Munich a la the DFB from a match against VfL Bochum earlier in the Bundesliga season. Per information from the governing body of German football (Deutscher Fussball Bund), the Rekordmeister had completed their equipment inspection ahead of their Bundesliga match week 8 match at VfL Bochum late (via @iMiaSanMia). The late completion of the equipment inspection led to the match officially kicking off two minutes later than it was supposed to. It kicked off at 10:32AM Eastern Standard Time when it was supposed to have kicked off at 10:30AM. This equated, at the time, to 3:30PM Central European Time or 3:32PM as it was the awkward period that occurs twice per season when North America and Europe are not aligned with their Daylight Savings Time schedules. As a result of the late kickoff, the DFB decided to give Bayern a fine of €20k, which the club did appeal. The club’s appeal, however, was rejected by the DFB and they will have to pay the fine as a result of just two minutes of tardiness tied to that particular kickoff. Bayern proceeded to win that match 5-0 after the ever so slightly delayed kickoff, having five different goal scorers on the afternoon (Michael Olise, Jamal Musiala, Harry Kane, Leroy Sane and Kingsley Coman). For what it’s worth, this is certainly not the first time Bayern has been fined by the DFB and it likely won’t be the last, though two minutes resulting in €20k does seem rather egregious in the grand scheme of things. It is hard to imagine two minutes affecting local public transportation, hospitality, and infrastructure as well as the Bundesliga — but it seems that if you are on time, you’re late, and if you’re early, you’re on time. Title: Joshua Kimmich backs Bayern Munich squad despite DFB-Pokal exit, Mainz loss
Content: Filed under: Kimmich still believes Bayern has the best squad in the Bundesliga and fully backs that sentiment. Within the span of just two weeks, there have been two more blips on Bayern Munich’s résumé for the season thus far, adding to the disappoint of the Champions League losses to both Aston Villa and Barcelona earlier on. They crashed out of the DFB-Pokal by virtue of a 1- loss to Bayer Leverkusen after Manuel Neuer was sent off in the first half, and more recently, that fell 2-1 at Mainz in the Bundesliga, perhaps really feeling the absence of both Neuer and the injured Harry Kane. Despite the loss to Mainz, Bayern is still four points clear of Leverkusen at the top of the Bundesliga table, and after their 5-1 win over Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League in Gelsenkirchen, they are in 10th the table for that competition — just two spots away from automatic qualification to the knockout stages. While it has been far from perfect in Vincent Kompany’s maiden season as manager of the Rekordmeister, there is no reason to panic or call for his removal, which is a sentiment shared by midfielder Joshua Kimmich. Speaking to Bild (via @iMiaSanMia), Kimmich reflected specifically on the Pokal loss to Leverkusen at the beginning of the month and felt that Bayern was perhaps unlucky to have come out on the losing side of that affair. Even with 10 men, Kimmich felt Bayern played quite well. “When we were eliminated against Leverkusen, it wasn’t a game where you would say that everything was bad, but rather that we have a great team and even with 10 players we are significantly better than the supposedly strongest team in Germany,” he ranted. For what it is worth, his point does sort of offer a zoomed-out view of some of Bayern’s draws and losses this season. Arguably, in the losses to Barcelona, Mainz, and perhaps even Villa, they did not play particularly well, but same cannot necessarily be said for the draws to Eintracht Frankfurt, Borussia Dortmund, Bayer Leverkusen, or as Kimmich alluded to, the Pokal loss to Leverkusen. On the surface, results can certainly be taken out of context, but it is rather more the combination of how Bayern played and the result that matters the most. Even for the Mainz loss, without the unlucky deflections for both of Lee Jae-sung’s goals, the result could have gone in Bayern’s favor or even have been a draw. Check your inbox for a welcome email. Title: Borussia Dortmund eye Bayern Munich talent Paul Wanner
Content: With Borussia Dortmund preparing their transfer targets for 2025, the Westfalen outfit have identified Bayern Munich talent Paul Wanner for a potential transfer, according to BILD. The 18-year-old, currently on loan at Heidenheim, is valued at €15m by Transfermarkt, and is regarded as one of the brightest prospects in German football. Die Schwarzgelben have been scouting Wanner for years and were close to signing the German-Austrian in 2021 until Bayern Munich blocked a transfer at the eleventh hour. And now Wanner has come to the attention of Dortmund once again. Per BILD, the attacking-midfielder has been mentioned as BVB’s recruitment team plan their transfer targets ahead of the 2025/26 season. Both Lars Ricken and Sebastian Kehl believe that Wanner has what it takes to play at Champions League level already. Wanner’s Bayern Munich contract runs until 2027 and the Rekordmeister aren’t planning to sell their talent, but although Dortmund wish to sign the playmaker on a permanent basis, a loan deal has been discussed although club bosses are yet to make any concrete approach although Wanner knows of Borussia’s interest. But Dortmund will face competition to sign Wanner. Should Florian Wirtz leave Bayer Leverkusen or Xavi Simons departs RB Leipzig, then the Bundesliga duo, as well as Eintracht Frankfurt and Stuttgart, will target the German youth international. Title: Barcelona president Laporta sends message to club’s fans before Atlético clash
Content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta has on Tuesday sent something of a rallying cry the way of the club’s supporters. This comes ahead of a crucial outing for Hansi Flick’s troops this coming weekend. Barcelona are set to play out their final fixture before the Christmas break this coming Saturday, when they welcome Diego Simeone’s Atlético Madrid to Catalunya’s capital for a La Liga clash. The two sides head into the matchup locked on points atop the Spanish top-flight, just a solitary point clear of arch rivals Real Madrid. Barca, for their part, have of course endured a difficult time of things on the domestic front of late, having emerged triumphant from just one of their last six in the league. Atlético, on the other hand, are the form team in Spanish football at this moment. Safe to say, then, that Saturday’s hosts will require all the help they can get in hopes of turning their fortunes around at Montjuïc. Speaking to the media on Tuesday, the aforementioned Joan Laporta therefore made use of the opportunity to send something of a plea to the Blaugrana faithful: “I urge the fans to give the best support they can for the match against Atlético Madrid. It’s absolutely crucial, like every other home match that has that feeling.” Conor Laird – GSFN @2023 - All Rights Reserved. Get Football Group

Title: Atlético Madrid star sits out training ahead of Barcelona
Content: A leading member of the attacking ranks at La Liga giants Atlético Madrid played no part in training on Tuesday. That’s according to Mundo Deportivo, who point towards Alexander Sørloth as the player in question. Frontman Sørloth, for his part, is fresh off a match-winning performance over the weekend, which saw the summer arrival in Spain’s capital notch the only goal in a La Liga victory over Getafe. This comes amid what has been a solid start to life for the Norwegian in the colours of Atlético. Those of a Rojiblancos persuasion, in turn, may have been concerned to hear that Sørloth was not part of the group of players put through their paces by Diego Simeone on Tuesday. This comes amid ongoing preparations for a top-of-the-table showdown with Barcelona this coming weekend. The Atléti faithful, however, need not fret. As confirmed by Mundo Deportivo: ‘The goalscorer against Getafe received a knock in the last match and the medical services preferred that he train on the sidelines as a precaution.’ Sørloth is expected to be passed fit to face Barcelona on Saturday night. Title: Does Real Madrid and Barcelona form open the way for an Atlético Madrid title charge?
Content: It’s been a strange weekend in Spanish football. Both Real Madrid and Barcelona have dropped points, with Barça losing 1-0 to Leganes, and Real Madrid drawing 3-3 with Las Palmas, albeit under controversial circumstances. Meanwhile, Atlético Madrid got a 1-0 win against Getafe, leaving them level on points with Barcelona at the top of the table with a game in hand. The next few weeks could be vital for Diego Simeone’s men, especially given their next match is taking on Barcelona at Montjüic, with the winner going clear at the top of the table. Given the recent news of Lamine Yamal’s injury, Barcelona will be in a tough spot as they play without a player who has truly transformed the way they play. The other point to keep in mind is the standing of Real Madrid, who are just one point back and also have a game in hand against bottom of the table Valencia. With the recent return of Robin Le Normand Atleti have overcome all their injuries, leaving them a clear run to try and stake their claim for the La Liga crown, all they have to do is go out there and perform. Title: View from the Fondo Sur: What is the secret to Atlético’s push for LaLiga?
Content: Filed under: Diego Simeone himself spoke about it as one of the team’s great positives this season As things stand at the time of writing, Atlético Madrid sit joint top of La Liga with 11 wins in a row and a game in hand over their next opponents and title rivals, FC Barcelona. It’s some change from the side who struggled to fourth last season, and it’s clear what the difference is: strength in depth. Atlético Madrid have scored more goals from the bench than any other team in Europe’s top five leagues with 10 goals scored, ahead of nine for Lazio and eight for Bayern Munich. Alexander Sørloth showed it again by scoring the winner against Getafe off the bench. At the other end, too, Atleti were able to draw against Getafe because of a pinpoint cross from Nahuel Molina, a second-choice option at right-back who came off the bench and influenced the game. Elsewhere, Robin Le Normand came on for the final few minutes. That’s some upgrade on the likes of Gabriel Paulista as the reserve option last season. In part, it’s down to the strength of the squad in terms of fitness. Luis Piñedo has made a real impact in driving the fitness of the squad, but also of avoiding injuries. Atleti have had less than half of the number of injuries they had last season, and many of those have been impact injuries, like the one which sidelined Le Normand for two, nearly three, months. Not only has there been an upgrade in the quality of players in the squad, but the more used players are available more often as well. At this point last season (July-December), Atlético Madrid have suffered 20 injuries. This season, they have only suffered 8.@atletico_stats_ pic.twitter.com/nSjnhruKhS Diego Simeone underlined the fact himself in his post-match press conference, reflecting that, “we have repeated the formation several times and there are players who are competing in an extraordinary way, showing what they can do when it’s their turn to come on. Let Llorente and Giuliano come off and Nahuel and Correa come on. Bring on Sorloth for Lino. Let Koke come in. That’s our strength. To compete the way we want to, we have to do it that way”. In 2023/24, only five players (Antoine Griezmann, Álvaro Morata, Ángel Correa, Samuel Lino and Memphis Depay) scored seven goals or more, and 14 different players scored over the course of the season. Already this season Atleti have three (Julián Álvarez, Antoine Griezmann and Alexander Sørloth), and two more are on track to hit that number in the coming weeks and with 13 total goalscorers. That’s without commenting on the case of Samuel Lino, the man who scored eight goals last season and is on only one this year, despite averaging more xG per 90. Much of that comes from some of Atleti’s super subs. Julián Álvarez, who himself grabbed his first goal off the bench, and Antoine Griezmann have established themselves as first choice in attack. Yet all of Ángel Correa’s five goals and two of his three assists have come off the bench, while Alexander Sørloth has got four goals and one assist after coming in. It’s not just goalscorers who are making the difference to Atleti this season, but having reliable and consistent goal-getters coming into the game has been pivotal. The bench has been crucial to getting points after going behind. Draws against Villarreal, Real Madrid and Rayo Vallecano, and wins against Paris Saint-Germain, Leganés, Alavés and Sevilla, have all seen the opposition take the lead and Atleti come back to claw 12 points in La Liga and three in the Champions League. Goals are like ketchup Yeah Sorloth is going on a scoring streak in our upcoming games be aware.pic.twitter.com/AHQSrhGVav For the first time since the international break in mid-November, Atlético now have a full seven-day rest period to prepare for their next fixture, the headline clash with FC Barcelona at the Estadio Olimpico Luis Companys next Sunday. In doing so, it ends a period where Atleti have rarely had more than 72 hours between fixtures for over a month. Diego Simeone exploded after the Champions League win over Slovan Bratislava, saying, “everyone needs to have rest and not play so tight. I’m just saying that because we played on Thursday, on Sunday at 9 p.m. when we had the Champions League and now on Wednesday and then on Sunday at 2 p.m. when we could play at night. But nobody cares.” But could there also be an argument that such momentum has helped Atlético? It’s allowed Simeone to rotate his key players and rest them, distributing his minutes throughout the squad and keeping his squad options satisfied. Given the low number of injuries with Luis Piñedo as fitness coach, and the team’s impressive record of late goals, tiredness hasn’t hit in yet either. A seven-day break seems a blessing, but it could be of more benefit for Barcelona than it is for Atleti. Gambling Problem? Call 1-800-GAMBLER (1-800-426-2537). Hope is here. Title: What is Clément Lenglet’s status for upcoming Barcelona vs Atlético clash?
Content: An insight into the status of on-loan Barcelona star Clément Lenglet for the Blaugrana’s upcoming meeting with Atlético Madrid has on Sunday been provided. Defender Lenglet of course sealed a fresh departure from Catalunya’s capital this past summer. Deemed surplus to requirements by Hansi Flick and co, the Frenchman went on to pen terms with the aforementioned Atlético, on loan for the duration of the campaign. And, in the time since, Lenglet has gone on to rebuild his reputation in impressive fashion. After a shaky start to life in Spain’s capital, hampered by fitness problems, recent weeks have seen the 29-year-old establish himself as an important figure in Diego Simeone’s backline. All told, Lenglet has been afforded 12 starts across all competitions, chipping in with a pair of goals along the way. And this run of appearances on the part of the one-time Sevilla man is expected to continue next weekend, against his parent club. As per a report from Diario Sport: ‘The truth is that Lenglet will be available for Diego Simeone, as neither Barcelona nor Atlético added any mention of a fear clause in the loan contract that was made official at the end of the last transfer window.’ Conor Laird – GSFN @2023 - All Rights Reserved.
